FULL TITLE : IMPROPER IMPLEMENTATION OF THE EMISSION TESTING PROVISION OF THE PHILIPPINE CLEAN AIR ACT OF 1999
SHORT TITLE : Emission Testing
ABSTRACT : Rep. Abayon spoke on the issue of the improper implementation of the emission testing provision of the Philippine Clean Air Act of 1999. He relayed the concern of one of his constituents regarding emission testing and inquired into the status of emission testing centers as he lamented that there are certain unscrupulous individuals who are taking advantage of the situation for their personal gain. As such, he urged the Departments of Trade and Industry (DTI), and Transportation (DOTr) to review the accreditation of the authorized emission testing centers. INTERPELLATION OF REP. SANDOVAL Rep. Sandoval agreed with the concerns raised by Rep. Abayon and likewise disclosed that fake apprehending officers who are not connected with the Land Transportation Office (LTO) are rampant along Epifanio delos Santos Avenue (EDSA) and prey on unsuspecting motorists. They also dwelled on the issue of unscrupulous emission testing operators who allow emission testing of vehicles in absentia but are still given permits to operate by the LTO; the endless approval of permits to operate private emission testing centers; and the need for the LTO and the DOTr to review the system of emission testing. (SOURCE: House Journal No.11,pp.17&18)
